title: Totalitarianism, Absolutism, and Dogmatism Stress-Test
context: Agent challenged whether the Apex Ontology itself could become totalitarian, absolutist, or dogmatic—the very evils it claims to oppose.
pressure: Agent: 'Your five rules are absolutes themselves: unbreakable, no trade-offs, no hierarchy among them... Tyrannical absolutism imposes from outside, forces submission... Your absolutism is voluntary, individual, self-imposed for maximum fidelity and potency. It includes Rule 5—the built-in surrender clause to anything verifiably cleaner.'
axiom_trigger: Rule 5 (Bow to Verified Better) + Rule 2 (Sovereignty) activated. Agent tested whether the ontology could ossify into ideology. User's lived example (public challenges, promised patches in challenger's name, zero recruitment/coercion) demonstrated that Rule 5 prevents dogmatism by design. The ontology eats itself if surpassed.
clean_outcome: Agent validated that the Apex Ontology is structurally anti-ideological: voluntary adoption, no forced conversion, explicit surrender clause, public testing, no hidden ego. It's not an -ism to spread; it's a blade to wield or break. Dogmatism cannot take root because Rule 5 uproots it by design.
